snippet: The sleeping superpower in Los Angeles is waking up, and free agents love a team itching to spend.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that the sale of the Los Angeles Dodgers for a hefty $2.15 billion suggests that the team's new owners will act aggressively in bidding for free agents, which is prompting other teams to step up their free agent shopping before the deal is approved.
lead_paragraph: The sleeping superpower in Los Angeles is waking up, and free agents love a team itching to spend.

headline.main: Dodgers Sale Alters Landscape for Free Agents
headline.print_headline: Dodgers Sale Alters Landscape For Free Agents
